application.label: EXMARaLDA Partitur-Editor
application.desc: Transcription Tool providing a TEI Export

revisionDesc.change: Created by XSL transformation from an EXMARaLDA basic transcription

spanGrp.span: What we c/ you could do, right?
Well, maybe this could be a suitable job, at a company called Tiekmann Söhne, as a truck driver.
No, I don't have a driver's license.
Well, then I'll have to have a look into my files.
No, the smell is too bad.
It's not always a matter of what the employee wants.
And you have to take what you get.
Even if it's a bit smelly.
Well yes, but I just can't tolerate that.
Well, if you do have a medical problem, then let's see.
Maybe we've got something else for you.
Would be very nice of you.
Oh, yes, maybe this could be something for you.
At a company called Gervais Blumenhandel, as a flower guard!
Where I have to make sure the flowers don't escape, or what?
No, you're not supposed to watch out that the flowers don't leave by themselves, you're supposed to make sure the flowers aren't stolen.
Well, I don't have a gun license, and with a gun I wouldn't want to anyway, okay?
No, no, no, that's not neccesary.
Well, and somehow it just doesn't appeal to me.
Well, but what do you have…
Well, the job is kinda stupid.
I mean, I've offered you three jobs, and you have to take one of them, right?
I could place you in the job as a truck driver.
I mean, without a driver's license that's not possible.
Well yes, but I don't really want to.
But if I kinda can't tolerate it…
So then you go and get one!
Or take the job in the leather factory.
Or otherwise the job as a flower guard.
There are no other vacancies in my files.
And there are others too, right, who are also looking for a job.
No, I've said, right, those jobs, they're not for me.
All of them, I'm all thumbs when it comes to those kinds of things, okay?
But I really am, I'm really all thumbs, Mr. Geritzen.
Well, then i'm afraid we have to reduce your unemployment benefits.
Have you gone completely mad, or what?
Yes, that's what I expected, you know, that...
No imagination, huh, Mr. Geritzen, no imagination, you guys at the job center, am I right?
